title: Electron installer for ACS distribution
description:
Set up an Electron app that serves as both the installer and GUI for the ACS system.

## Requirements
- Electron app bundles the ACS binary and installs it on the user's system
- The bundled frontend reads the ACS daemon's port info and connects to it
- Provides a GUI to manage the ACS system (view/create/edit/delete jobs, view logs, etc.)
- Installer handles first-time setup (installing the acs binary, setting up the daemon service)
- The Electron shell wraps the existing Next.js frontend, pointing it at the local ACS daemon

## Key Decisions
- How to detect/read the daemon's port (config file, default port, discovery)
- Installer flow: install binary, start daemon, launch GUI
- Platform targets: Windows first, then macOS/Linux

## Acceptance Criteria
- User can download and run the Electron installer
- ACS binary is installed and daemon starts
- GUI connects to the running daemon and provides full management capabilities

title: BUG: ScriptFile trigger args broken on Unix - passed as single filename arg
description: In executor.rs build_command(), ScriptFile with trigger args does cb.arg(&effective_script) where effective_script is 'deploy.sh --env staging'. On Unix this passes the entire concatenated string as a single argument to /bin/sh (without -c), so sh tries to open a file literally named 'deploy.sh --env staging'. Fix: For ScriptFile on Unix, use /bin/sh -c 'script args' or pass args separately. Need to write a test that validates the bug first, then fix. When fixed, update job-management.md ScriptFile trigger args section.
close_reason: Fixed: ScriptFile on Unix now uses /bin/sh -c when trigger args present. PowerShell uses -Command instead of -File when trigger args present. Tests added. Doc updated in job-management.md.

title: BUG: stderr pipe created but never read - output silently lost
description: NoPtySpawner sets stderr(Stdio::piped()) at pty/mod.rs:84 but NoPtyProcess::read() at lines 108-114 only reads from self.child.stdout. All stderr output is silently discarded. When this is fixed, update docs that say 'stdout only' back to 'stdout/stderr': job-management.md execution section, and any other references.
notes: Docs updated to say 'stdout only' in: job-management.md (line 189), architecture.md (section 5.3), storage.md (line 141). When this bug is fixed, change these back to 'stdout/stderr'.
